5e7c863b-57e9-44f3-b174-60b360dee923.description: A CCIM designee is a Certified Commercial Investment Member. For over 50 years, the CCIM designation remains the gold standard for commercial real estate professionals. CCIMs complete a rigorous program of advanced coursework and training in financial and market analysis, and demonstrate extensive experience in the commercial real estate industry. CCIM designees encompass a network of highly experienced commercial real estate professionals all over the world.
5e7c863b-57e9-44f3-b174-60b360dee923.name: CCIM Designee: 5+ Years

badge_template_activities.title: CI 101: Financial Analysis for Commercial Real Estate — This course provides a foundation of practical financial analysis skills.
CI 102: Market Analysis for Commercial Real Estate — Analyze investment factors for each of four major property types: office, industrial, multifamily, and retail.
Negotiations — Commercial real estate negotiations training.
CI 103: User Decision Analysis for Commercial Real Estate — Utilize market and financial analysis skills for user space decisions, and apply cost-of-occupancy models for ownership and leasing.
CI 104: Investment Analysis for Commercial Real Estate — Optimize investment returns and effectively forecast investment performance by quantifying real estate risk.
Ethics — This course covers the CCIM Code and Standards of Practice of CCIM Institute.
Elective Credits — Two full elective credits must be earned through non-designation courses, eligible transfer credits, and continuous candidacy.
Portfolio of Qualifying Experience — To demonstrate experience in commercial real estate, a portfolio of qualifying activities, transactions, or projects must be submitted.
Comprehensive Exam — The comprehensive exam is a full-day exam testing mastery of the concepts introduced in the CCIM designation courses.

Instructor Training (Candidate to Workshop Leader) — Candidates who successfully participate in Instructor Candidate Training are elevated to workshop leader where they complete three co-teaching assignments with senior instructors.

Instructor Training (Workshop Leader to Junior Instructor) — Workshop leaders must achieve an average of 4.25 on student and senior instructor evaluations to be approved by the Faculty Subcommittee for promotion to junior instructor.

Instructor Training (Junior Instructor to Senior Instructor) — Junior instructors must co-teach a total of four times with a senior instructor, achieve an average of 4.50 on student and senior instructor evaluations, and present three letters of recommendation from senior instructors to be approved by the Faculty Subcommittee for promotion to senior instructor.
